title: How to Make Jasmine and Green Tea Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: Prepare the baking tray (sheet) by covering in baking (parchment) paper.

steps.headline: Mix the flour, baking powder and sugar together in a large mixing bowl.
Open the green tea and jasmine teabag.
steps.description: Tip the tea leaves into the mixing bowl.

steps.headline: Add the melted butter, then the egg and a handful of chocolate drops.
Drop teaspoonful of batter onto the baking tray (sheet).
steps.description: Leave enough space for spread during cooking.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for around 12 minutes or until the edges of the cookies turn golden in color.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.

text: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Prepare the baking tray (sheet) by covering in baking (parchment) paper. Mix the flour, baking powder and sugar together in a large mixing bowl.  Open the green tea and jasmine teabag. Tip the tea leaves into the mixing bowl. Add the melted butter, then the egg and a handful of chocolate drops. Combine well. Drop teaspoonful of batter onto the baking tray (sheet). Leave enough space for spread during cooking. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for around 12 minutes or until the edges of the cookies turn golden in color. Remove from the oven and allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.  Finished.
